metadata.title: CVE-2023-49286 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Squid is a caching proxy for the Web supporting HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, and more.Due to an Incorrect Check of Function Return Value bug Squid is vulnerableto a Denial of Service attack against its Helper process management. Thisbug is fixed by Squid version 6.5. Users are advised to upgrade. There areno known workarounds for this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-49286` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squid-cgi - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squid-common - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squid-openssl - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squid-purge - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
squidclient - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.3').
